articles.headline: Asked to Stop Investigations, House Digs In
articles.snippet: The House Intelligence Committee began a broad inquiry into whether Russia and other foreign powers may be exercising influence over President Trump.
articles.abstract: The House Intelligence Committee began a broad inquiry into whether Russia and other foreign powers may be exercising influence over President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Intelligence Committee on Wednesday began a broad inquiry into whether Russia and other foreign powers may be exercising influence over President Trump, acting only hours after a defiant Speaker Nancy Pelosi declared that the House would not be cowed by the president’s “all-out threat” to drop its investigations of his administration.

articles.headline: Second Virginia Democrat Says He Wore Blackface, Throwing Party Into Turmoil
articles.snippet: Attorney General Mark Herring, like Gov. Ralph Northam, said he dressed in blackface years ago. And a woman came forward to describe being sexually assaulted by the lieutenant governor.
articles.abstract: Attorney General Mark Herring, like Gov. Ralph Northam, said he dressed in blackface years ago. And a woman came forward to describe being sexually assaulted by the lieutenant governor.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — The third-ranking elected official in Virginia, Attorney General Mark R. Herring, acknowledged Wednesday that he had worn blackface at a party as an undergraduate student, deepening a crisis that has engulfed the state’s Democratic leadership.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: After Uproar, Instacart Backs Off Controversial Tipping Policy
articles.snippet: The delivery app’s practice of counting tips toward guaranteed minimum payments for its contract workers drew accusations of wage theft.
articles.abstract: The delivery app’s practice of counting tips toward guaranteed minimum payments for its contract workers drew accusations of wage theft.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gig economy’s work force is fighting back, and in some cases, it’s winning.

articles.headline: Trump Nominates David Malpass to Head World Bank
articles.snippet: Mr. Malpass, a Treasury official, has criticized the World Bank’s lending practices and business model. His appointment may be controversial over concerns that the role is being politicized.
articles.abstract: Mr. Malpass, a Treasury official, has criticized the World Bank’s lending practices and business model. His appointment may be controversial over concerns that the role is being politicized.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Wednesday nominated David Malpass, a top Treasury official and Wall Street veteran, to be the next president of the World Bank.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Binyamin Appelbaum

articles.headline: A Desperate Exodus From ISIS’ Final Village
articles.snippet: A stream of families and fighters, many of them hungry or injured, are surrendering on a rocky patch of desert in southeastern Syria.
articles.abstract: A stream of families and fighters, many of them hungry or injured, are surrendering on a rocky patch of desert in southeastern Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEIR AL-ZOUR PROVINCE, Syria — The men who emerge from the Islamic State’s last sliver of land are ordered to sit behind one of two orange lines spray-painted on the rocky desert floor: Syrians behind one and Iraqis behind the other.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi and Ivor Prickett

articles.headline: Beto O’Rourke Was Once Adrift in New York City. Now He’s Searching Again.
articles.snippet: As the former Texas congressman weighs a run for president, his rebel-in-moderation youth offers revealing parallels to his search for direction now.
articles.abstract: As the former Texas congressman weighs a run for president, his rebel-in-moderation youth offers revealing parallels to his search for direction now.
articles.lead_paragraph: All at once, New York City seemed to be conspiring against Beto O’Rourke.

articles.headline: Trump Loves the New Nafta. Congress Doesn’t.
articles.snippet: The president’s most significant achievement on trade — a revised deal with Canada and Mexico — is imperiled amid Democratic and Republican concerns.
articles.abstract: The president’s most significant achievement on trade — a revised deal with Canada and Mexico — is imperiled amid Democratic and Republican concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump lauded his new trade agreement with Canada and Mexico in his State of the Union address on Tuesday and urged Congress to pass the revised pact. The deal, he argued, will help American farmers and workers and ensure “that more cars are proudly stamped with the four beautiful words: Made in the U.S.A.”

articles.headline: Painting Socialists as Villains, Trump Refreshes a Blueprint
articles.snippet: Casting socialism as a threat could become the kind of rhetorical touchstone of President Trump’s re-election campaign that sounding the alarm about “criminal illegal aliens” was in 2016.
articles.abstract: Casting socialism as a threat could become the kind of rhetorical touchstone of President Trump’s re-election campaign that sounding the alarm about “criminal illegal aliens” was in 2016.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has proved himself adroit at creating villains to serve as his political foils. In his State of the Union address on Tuesday, he introduced a new one: socialists.

articles.headline: Fighting Brexit, One Caller and 100,000 YouTube Clicks at a Time
articles.snippet: The talk radio host James O’Brien argues with Brexiteers every day on his show. It’s unclear if he has changed any minds, but it sure has made him famous.
articles.abstract: The talk radio host James O’Brien argues with Brexiteers every day on his show. It’s unclear if he has changed any minds, but it sure has made him famous.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The talk radio host James O’Brien generally speaks to callers in the calm, resolute tone of a guy working at a suicide prevention hotline. Many of those callers ardently want Britain to leave the European Union, an idea that Mr. O’Brien regards as an economic calamity in the making. To him, the upsides of staying in the union are a matter of irrefutable logic.

articles.headline: How Facebook’s Tiny China Sales Floor Helps Generate Big Ad Money
articles.snippet: In the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, Facebook, working with a local partner, has found a way to overcome China’s internet blocks to make ad dollars.
articles.abstract: In the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, Facebook, working with a local partner, has found a way to overcome China’s internet blocks to make ad dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENZHEN — Facebook’s apps and websites have been blocked in China for years. The company has no office in the country that supports its social networking services. And its attempts to open a subsidiary have been quickly snuffed out.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Lin Qiqing

articles.headline: Germany Restricts Facebook’s Data Gathering
articles.snippet: The competition authority said the company could no longer combine data from different sources without explicit permission from users.
articles.abstract: The competition authority said the company could no longer combine data from different sources without explicit permission from users.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a direct challenge to Facebook’s business model, Germany’s competition authority on Thursday sharply curtailed how the tech giant may profile people, saying that users could refuse to allow the company to combine their Facebook information with data about their activities on other sites.

articles.headline: The Financial Crisis Put a Chill on Big Bank Deals. That Ended Thursday.
articles.snippet: If approved, the merger of BB&T and SunTrust would create the sixth-biggest bank in the U.S., large enough to compete against the country’s largest lenders.
articles.abstract: If approved, the merger of BB&T and SunTrust would create the sixth-biggest bank in the U.S., large enough to compete against the country’s largest lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two banks announced the industry’s biggest merger in a decade on Thursday, signaling bank executives’ growing confidence that the regulatory constraints imposed after the 2008 financial crisis have begun to loosen.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Emily Flitter

articles.headline: Virginia Political Crisis Grows for Democrats and Republicans
articles.snippet: Allegations of racism that have besieged Democrats have spread to a G.O.P. lawmaker, who helped oversee a college yearbook with racist photographs and slurs.
articles.abstract: Allegations of racism that have besieged Democrats have spread to a G.O.P. lawmaker, who helped oversee a college yearbook with racist photographs and slurs.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — The political tumult in Virginia widened Thursday as the State Senate’s top Republican faced an onslaught of questions about racist photographs and slurs in a college yearbook that he helped oversee, transforming the Capitol’s nearly week-old crisis into a bipartisan reckoning over personal conduct.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder and Jonathan Martin
